etymologies: late Middle English: from late Latin appositio(n-), from apponere ‘to apply’ (see apposite)

definitions: the positioning of things or the condition of being side by side or close together.
shortDefinitions: positioning of things side by side

definitions: a relationship between two or more words or phrases in which the two units are grammatically parallel and have the same referent (e.g. my friend Sue; the first US president, George Washington).
shortDefinitions: relationship between two or more words or phrases in which two units are grammatically parallel
